title: Authors and Citation
text: Jan Lisec. Author, maintainer. Friederike Hoffmann. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hoffmann F, Jaeger C, Bhattacharya , Schmitt C, Lisec J (2018). “Non-targeted identification tracer incorporation high-resolution mass spectrometry.” Analytical Chemistry.
code: @Article{,   title = {Non-targeted identification of tracer incorporation in high-resolution mass spectrometry.},   author = {Friederike Hoffmann and Carsten Jaeger and Animesh Bhattacharya and Clemens A. Schmitt and Jan Lisec},   journal = {Analytical Chemistry},   year = {2018}, }

what: Non-Targeted Fluxomics on High-Resolution Mass-Spectrometry Data
title: Non-Targeted Fluxomics on High-Resolution Mass-Spectrometry Data
text: Identifying labeled compounds 13C-tracer experiment non-targeted fashion cumbersome process. package facilitates type analyses providing high level quality control plots, spectra deconvolution evaluation performing multitude tests automatic fashion. main idea use changing intensity ratios ion pairs peak list, generated .e. xcms, candidates evaluate base peak chromatograms spectra information within raw measurement data automatically. functionality described scientific article.

what: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
text: DeconvoluteSpectrum evaluate list `xcmsRaw`     `xcmsRawLike` objects given time (rt) potential mass (mz1).     main purpose deconvolute mass spectrum rt including mz1.

title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
code: DeconvoluteSpectrum(   dat = NULL,   rt = NULL,   rt_dev = 3,   mz1 = NULL,   mz_dev = 0.003,   use.mz.adjust = FALSE,   ionization = c("APCI", "ESI")[1],   smooth = 0 )

title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
text: dat list `xcmsRaw` `xcmsRawLike` objects. rt Retention time expected peak. rt_dev Allowed retention time deviation. mz1 specified, ensure mass included spectrum (assumed base peak). Can NULL otherwise case intense peak rt selected mz1. mz_dev Allowed mz deviation [Da]. use.mz.adjust adjust mz experiment wide basis. ionization Either APCI ESI. Choice modify internal parameters checks performed. smooth Smoothing parameter passed getMultipleBPC.

title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
text: pseudo spectrum rt (containing mz1 specified). Effectively     2-column matrix (mz, int) rt attribute.

title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum
text: specific advantage DeconvoluteSpectrum ,     deconvolute signals within single measurement file uses correlation     tests set measurements improve statistical power. test     mz around specified rt co-apex mz1, low rt     difference consistent intensity ratio samples.

title: Deconvolute a Mass Spectrum from a list of raw data files. — DeconvoluteSpectrum

what: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
title: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
text: EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData compare result     function EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet raw data files.

title: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
code: EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData(   x = NULL,   tp = NULL,   gr = NULL,   dat = NULL,   dmz = 0.025,   drt = 1,   dEcut = 1,   Pcut = 0.01,   Icut = 1000,   method = c("APCI", "ESI")[1],   rolp = c("non", "pos", "neg", "all")[2],   smooth = 0 )

title: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
text: x Dataframe results (output EvaluatePairsFromXCMSet). tp Timepoint. gr group, e.g. different genotypes concentrations. dat list xcmsRaw's deconvolution plotting. dmz Allowed mass deviation Da (BPC extraction). drt Allowed rt deviation seconds (get extraction). dEcut Minimum required change enrichment candidate ID assigned. Pcut Maximum allowed P value candidate ID assigned. Icut Minimum required median peak intensity candidate ID assigned. method Either APCI ESI. Choice modify internal parameters checks performed. rolp RemoveOverLappingPeaks parameter, overlapping means deconvoluted spectrum another peak already evaluated. smooth Smoothing parameter passed getMultipleBPC.

title: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
text: list evaluation results.

title: Evaluate m/z pairs against raw data. — EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData
text: function evaluate candidate mz pairs found within `xcmsSet`    object peak list EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet raw    measurement data.    step required minimize redundancy false positive results.    allow generate number informative quality control plots.    quite input data required function, please look    vignette example.    special parameter function `rolp` can set 'non',    'pos', 'neg' ''. influence time performance function    determining many peaks effectively tested. `rolp` set    'non', overlapping peaks skipped, every individual mz-pair    sequentially evaluated (slow informative). set 'pos'    'neg', overlapping peaks (determined experiment wide deconvolution)    tested additionally positive negative hits ('neg'    standard). set '' overlapping peaks always removed    list mz-pairs tested (fast).

what: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
text: EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet analyze `xcmsSet` result     generic peak list mass spectrometry experiment mass     pairs (mz1, mz2) changes due tracer incorporation.

title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
code: EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet(   xg = NULL,   tp = NULL,   gr = NULL,   drt = 1,   dmz = 0.025,   mz_iso = 1.00335,   n = 6,   method = c("APCI", "ESI")[1],   specific_row = NULL,   testing = FALSE,   silent = FALSE )

title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
text: xg xcmsSet object group information. Alternatively, can numeric matrix containing `mz` `rt` information first two columns followed peak intensities samples order parameters `tp` `gr`. tp Time point information samples (obviously required, internally converted factor). gr Group information samples, e.g. different genotypes concentrations (optional, factor). drt Allowed rt deviation time units xcmsSet (usually seconds) test candidates. dmz Allowed mass deviation Da. mz_iso Mass defect isotope investigation (use 1.00335 ^13^C experiments. n Number maximal incorporated carbons test. method Currently APCI ESI. APCI, dmz modified depending n (see details). specific_row single row peak list process. testing Stop function using browser() specific_row specified; can isotope number, .e. 3 stop third isotope. silent Suppress warnings console output TRUE.

title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
text: dataframe observable pairs within provided xg object     (usually `xcmsSet` peak) list including mean group intensities P values.

title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet
text: Using 'APCI' method assumes () analyze TMS-derivatized     compounds (ii) MS resolution allow separate Si C     isotopes reports intermediate mass m/z. case     find carbon isotopes expected masses, .e. M+1     1.001 mDa apart M+0 instead 1.003.     effect increased isotope number, .e. M+6 ~20 mDa     expected value. Hence, selecting method 'APCI' combine     selected dmz allowed deviation due mass shifts caused Si     isotopes. Use 'ESI' sure effect takes place     settings.

title: Identify and evaluate mz pairs from a peak list. — EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet

title: Generate a table for the candidates obtained in EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData. — GenerateCandXLSX
text: res_list list result objects (testing individual mz pair). xlsx_file File name. rejected Logical. Prepare table rejected candidates TRUE.

title: Generate a table for the candidates obtained in EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData. — GenerateCandXLSX
text: Candidate table data.frame.

title: Generate a table for the candidates obtained in EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData. — GenerateCandXLSX
text: Just wrapper, get important information tabular layout.

title: Generate a table for the candidates obtained in EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData. — GenerateCandXLSX
code: # load evaluation result of example data and # generate table within R (use parameter xlsx_file to write to file) x <- GenerateCandXLSX(HiResTEC::res_list) str(x) #> 'data.frame':	1 obs. of  10 variables: #>  $ ID             : num 1 #>  $ RT             : num 1027 #>  $ mz             : num 556 #>  $ dE             : num 41.1 #>  $ P              : num 2.86e-16 #>  $ Name           : chr "" #>  $ row            : chr "23" #>  $ BaseFormula    : chr "C5" #>  $ Spectrum       : chr "540.2308:70229 541.2324:35446 542.2299:15238 543.2299:5300 554.2459:8944 555.2539:74536 556.2631:3312706 556.56"| __truncated__ #>  $ OverlappingLine: chr "10, 12, 9, 13, 14, 23, 25, 24, 3, 26, 4, 15, 33, 34, 5, 27, 35, 8" x[,1:5] #>   ID       RT      mz    dE            P #> 1  1 1026.544 556.262 41.11 2.862525e-16

what: Different example data files to be used in the help section of `HiResTEC` functions. — raw
title: Different example data files to be used in the help section of `HiResTEC` functions. — raw
text: `raw` contains list `xcmsRawLike` objects, containing selected mass range small retention time window 18 samples defined sam. `sam` provides data frame containing sample definition 18 samples larger experiment. `xcms_cand` contains data frame analysis result `xcmsSet` obtained using EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet. `res_list` list containing evaluations results established based processing example data EvaluateCandidateListAgainstRawData. `mz_shift_corrector` contains list defining windows high res APCI ESI instrumentation.

title: Different example data files to be used in the help section of `HiResTEC` functions. — raw
Different example data files to be used in the help section of `HiResTEC` functions. — raw
text: object class list length 18. object class data.frame 18 rows 8 columns. object class data.frame 72 rows 19 columns. object class list length 14. object class list length 3.

what: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
text: getMultipleBPC extract multiple BPCs `xcmsRaw`     `xcmsRawLike` object vector mz within limits given rt,     rt_dev mz_dev.

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
code: getMultipleBPC(   x,   mz = NULL,   mz_dev = 0.005,   rt = NULL,   rt_dev = 2,   zeroVal = NA,   smooth = 0,   returnEIC = FALSE )

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
text: x `xcmsRaw` `xcmsRawLike` object. mz Numeric vector masses NULL (default) return overall BPC. mz_dev Allowed mass deviations (can single numeric, vector, matrix one row (lower bound, upper bound) matrix length(mz) rows giving lower upper bound mz). rt Target retention time NULL (default) use full time range. rt_dev Allowed time deviation (rt specified). zeroVal Set values <=0 NA keep NULL. smooth Window size moving average smoother, 0 = smoothing. returnEIC Return EIC instead BPC?

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
text: matrix scan wise (rows) intensities requested masses (columns)     either EIC BPC.

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
text: functions extract BPC information raw data,     one particularly useful get traces belonging isotopologue     group. attach several derived values results object,     .e. describing observed mass shift (deviation expected value)     helpful QC non-targeted tracer analyses.     `mz` `mz_dev` parameters can vectorized, `rt`     `rt_dev` values consistently used ion traces.

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC
text: Uses C code modified XCMS (see citation("xcms")).

title: Extract multiple ion chromatograms from mass spectrometry data. — getMultipleBPC

what: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
text: plotBPC plot item list result-objects     getMultipleBPC BPC traces spectrum scan     summed intensity ions max.

title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
code: plotBPC(   bpc = NULL,   mfrow = NULL,   skip_plots = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   col = NULL,   ids = NULL,   type = "both",   ann = c("mdev", "mz", "none") )

title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
text: bpc bpc object (list intensity matrices, rt x mz, including several attributes attached getMultipleBPC). mfrow Specify mfrow explicitly (optimized internally NULL cover n=length(bpc)). skip_plots Allows block certain subplots mfrow matrix better align replicates. ylim Can specified specifically, adjusted overall min/max otherwise. col Specific color vector masses may provided. ids Specific plot ids may explicitly provided. type Switch co-plot BPC Spectrum ("") BPC alone ("bpc"). ann Select value annotate peaks spectrum. Usually mass deviation expected value mDa.

title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
text: plot graphics device NULL invisible.

title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
text: plotBPC allows get quick overview similar information     samples experimental set. uses `mfrow` arrange samples     output can used subplot figures.

title: Plot base peak chromatograms for multiple high resolution masses in multiple samples. — plotBPC
code: # load example raw data bpc <- HiResTEC::res_list[[1]][["bpc"]][c(1:2, 13:14)] plotBPC(bpc = bpc)  plotBPC(bpc = bpc, ann="mz", ids=LETTERS[1:4], mfrow=c(3,2), skip_plots=c(2,3))

what: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
text: plotMID plot Mass Isotopomer Distributions (MIDs).

title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
code: plotMID(   mid = NULL,   gr = NULL,   name = "unknown",   contr = NULL,   stackedbars = FALSE,   subplot_ylim = 100,   ... )

title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
text: mid Matrix corrected MIDs. Samples columns, MID values rows. gr Groups, factor vector length ncol(mid). name Name analyte annotation. contr Contrasts. yet clear useful. stackedbars Alternative plotting layout using stacked bar plot. subplot_ylim Calculate `ylim` individually per subplot 0, show full range subplots 100 limit minimal specified number otherwise. ... arguments 'boxplot' 'barplot' (depending parameter 'stackedbars').

title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
text: annotated barplot boxplot.

title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
text: Multiple styling options available using function parameters.

title: Plot a Mass Isotopomer Distribution (MID) for multiple samples. — plotMID
code: mid <- matrix(c(seq(0, 0.3, 0.1), seq(1, 0.7, -0.1)), byrow = TRUE, nrow = 2) gr <- gl(2, 2, labels = letters[1:2]) plotMID(mid = mid, gr = gr, name = "Metabolite X")  plotMID(mid = mid, gr = gr, stackedbars = TRUE, las = 1, xlab = "MID")  lt <- paste0("M", 0:1) rownames(mid) <- lt plotMID(mid = mid, gr = gr, stackedbars = TRUE, xlab = "MID", legend.text = lt)  plotMID(mid = mid[, 2, drop = FALSE], stackedbars = TRUE, col = c(3, 4))  colnames(mid) <- paste0("S", 1:4) gr2 <- gl(n = 1, k = 1, labels = "bla") plotMID(mid = mid[, 2, drop = FALSE], gr = gr2, stackedbars = TRUE, name = NULL)  plotMID(mid = mid, gr = factor(colnames(mid)), stackedbars = TRUE, name = NULL)

title: HiResTEC 0.63.2
text: removed plyr dependency setting internal function ldply_base() fixed corrupted example data raw set testthat incorporated first test functions

title: HiResTEC 0.63.1
text: CRAN release: 2025-02-27 Using pkgdown show vignette directly github page Improved documentation bringing back examples help files

title: HiResTEC 0.62.4
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package Added example data xcmsRawLike format Added Vignette showing workflow based example data DeconvoluteSpectrum() can handle now missing mz1 parameter getMultipleBPC() better handles unspecified mz parameter EvaluatePairsFromXCMSSet() now also accepts simple peak lists independent xcms
